title: Arizona Sunshine 2 Review - The Walking Shred
description:
The first time I played Arizona Sunshine 2, I left feeling a bit nauseated, but I soon realized this was due to my time spent away from playing VR games. The second time I played Arizona Sunshine 2, I was quickly overwhelmed by its hordes of undead and left feeling like the game was perhaps unbalanced. By the third time I put on my Quest 3 headset, I'd rediscovered my proverbial sea legs, I'd mastered the art of zombie crowd control, and I enjoyed the game for what it is: an arcadey trek through the apocalypse.

In the VR-exclusive first-person zombie shooter Arizona Sunshine 2, you'll take on the role of the original game's hero for another excursion through an undead hellscape of airports, sewage tunnels, and rooftop parking lots, each of them loaded with ammo and "Freds"--the too-jokey protagonist's word for zombies--in similar quantities. The game's intentions are clear right away: This i

title: Assassin's Creed Mirage Adds New Game Plus, Parkour Improvements, And More
description:
It's time to go again with Bayek in Assassin's Creed Mirage, as the game has received a New Game Plus mode. That's not all, either, as the patch released yesterday, December 11, introduced an Origins-inspired outfit, parkour enhancements, and tons of bug fixes for the title.

To gain access to New Game Plus, Ubisoft notes Assassin's Creed Mirage players must have completed the main story. Afterward, they can start a second playthrough with all of their previously earned skills and costumes. This mode also lets people bypass the prologue and take a leap of faith right into Baghdad.

New Game Plus will also immediately give players access to the Origins-inspired Bayek's Medjay outfit. Ubisoft adds that three dyes can be earned on their second playthrough. Another improvement noted with this patch

title: Lego Fortnite: Where To Find Amber And How To Process It
description:
Amber is an important mid-tier material needed in Lego Fortnite. Amber is used to upgrade your village, along with crafting rare axes, which are needed to cut down some of the rarer trees. Amber is found in its rough form and will need to be processed before you can use it for crafting tools and upgrading your village. Here's where you can mine and process amber in Lego Fortnite.

Where to find amber

Amber is found in the dry valley biome, which is a desert area. Unfortunately, the biome locations are ge

title: Lego Fortnite: Where To Find Knotroot
description:
For the first hour or two you spend in a new world in Lego Fortnite, resources are plentiful and generally lying all over the place near wherever you happen to set up your village. But when it comes time to upgrade to level 4, you'll need something new: knotroot. You won't find this stuff just anywhere, and when you do find it your basic forest axe just ain't gonna cut it, either figuratively or literally. But don't worry, we'll walk you through all the steps you'll need to take to get started harvesting knotroot.

What you need to harvest knotroot

To start with, you'll need an uncommon (green) forest axe, which is one quality level better than the first axe you're able to craft at your workbench. So you'll need to upgrade the bench for the first time, which requires eight

title: 8BitDo's Xbox-Branded Sega Controller Releases This Month, Available To Preorder Now
description:
8BitDo is releasing a new wired, Xbox version of its excellent M30 Sega gamepad. The $35 controller launches on December 22 and is available for preorder now at Amazon.

See at Amazon

Like other 8BitDo M30 controllers, this new Xbox-branded version features six face buttons--A, B, X, T, RT, and RB--a D-pad, and four shoulder buttons, as well as the standard Xbox controller's share, menu, and Xbox dashboard buttons. There's also a custom profile switcher that lets you swap between up to three custom button layouts on the fly and a 3.5mm audio jack and volume controls for headphones.

The controller is compatible with Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and Windows, and connects to your devices via the included USB-C cable. While that limits the wired M

title: Zelda Boss Hints That Traditional Linear Zelda Games Aren't Coming Back Any Time Soon
description:
With The Legend Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom selling millions of copies and raking in awards, questions have been raised about what's next for the Zelda series, and whether or not the future may include blasts from the past. Franchise head Eiji Aonuma is here to pump the brakes, as he says the traditional linear Zelda adventures of old won't be coming back any time soon.

Speaking with IGN, Aonuma expresses his belief that those views come from a "grass is greener" mentality--where people have a tendency to want the things they don't currently have. He continues by stating that the current Zelda format does have a "set" path; however, that path is chosen by the player rather than the designers.

"It's interesting when I hear people say [they prefer the older games] because I am wondering, 'Why do you want to go back to

title: Federal Court Rules For Epic Games In Google Antitrust Case
description:
A federal jury has submitted a verdict in the antitrust case between Epic Games and Google, and the Fortnite developer has reason to celebrate. The jury ruled unanimously in favor of Epic, as it determined Google holds an illegal monopoly through its Google Play Store.

The ruling follows a four-week court trial between the two giant corporations, which was meant to decide whether or not Google was using anti-competitive tactics with its online store, where millions of apps are sold daily. The decision came after just three hours of closed-door deliberations.

Victory over Google! After 4 weeks of detailed court testimony, the California jury found against the Google Play monopoly on all counts. The Court’s work on remedies will start in January. Thanks for everyone’s support

title: Hasbro Cuts 900 More Jobs, Total Layoffs Amount To 29% Of Entire Company
description:
Toy and entertainment giant Hasbro is cutting a significant amount of jobs, citing a softer market for toys. Hasbro said in an SEC filing that it conducted a "further review" of its cost structure and organization design, and it is shedding 900 jobs as a result. Hasbro said this will include both voluntary early retirement and layoffs, which are due to be completed in the next 18-24 months.

This move comes after Hasbro announced a cost-savings effort in October 2022 and announced a plan to eliminate about 1,000 jobs, which works out to about 15% of the company's total workforce. Hasbro said it expected to spend more than $94 million for severance, stock compensation, and employee benefits related to those cuts. The 900 job losses announced today bring the total number of cuts to 1,900, with a further $40 million in expenses related to the cuts.

title: See Your Most-Played Xbox Games And Other Stats For 2023 With This Year-In-Review Tool
description:
Microsoft has released its annual Year in Review website that allows fans to see which games they played the most, how many hours they spent playing, the total number of achievements unlocked, and more. Microsoft published this on the same day that PlayStation launched its own similar program.

On Xbox, you can visit the Year in Review website to get started. From there, you just need to log in and you'll see all your stats, including total time played, total games played, total gamerscore unlocked, total number of achievements earned, and the top month for play time. The website also shows you your top genres and how your numbers stack up against the wider Xbox community.

Fans can share their year-

title: Recently Released Nitro Deck Nintendo Switch Controller Gets First Discount At Amazon
description: CRKD Nitro Deck Handheld Controller

title: Indiana Jones Game Skipping PlayStation Isn't An "Overly Exclusionary" Move, Disney Says
description:
Disney's top gaming boss, Sean Shoptaw, has commented on why he believes Bethesda's upcoming Indiana Jones game being exclusive to Xbox is not an "overly exclusionary" move.

According to Axios, Microsoft asked Disney to renegotiate the terms of the game's business arrangement following Microsoft's buyout of Bethesda parent company ZeniMax. The report said Microsoft sought a new deal to prevent the game from coming to PlayStation so it could be exclusive to Xbox on console and also have a PC release.

Shoptaw said Xbox is "one of the bigger marketplaces for games." As such, he said Disney "didn't feel like we were going to be overly exclusionary."

Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Former Rockstar Dev Explains Why GTA 6 PC Port Isn't Coming At Launch
description:
Grand Theft Auto VI is officially releasing on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S in 2025, but PC players will have to wait even longer, with Rockstar confirming the game won't be available on PC at launch. But why?

According to former Rockstar developer Mike York, who worked at the studio from 2012-2017 on projects like GTA V and Red Dead Redemption 2, it simply comes down to a matter of priority.

"They want to prioritize what sells," York said in a recent video about the subject posted to his personal YouTube channel. "Most of the time, especially in the past, PlayStation was the big seller. PlayStation was the console to have

title: PlayStation Wrap-Up 2023 Is Live, Will Remind You Of Literal Days Spent Playing PS5
description:
As the year begins to wind down, it's time to see just how many hours you spent playing your favorite games. The 2023 edition of PlayStation Wrap-Up is now live, and just like last year, you can explore a summary of your gaming habits through some neat trading card-sized slides.

You can see the first game you played this year, the game that monopolized your time the most, your achievements for the year, the trophies you earned, and what your most-played games were from month to month. Since we're still in the first half of December, any additional sessions on your PlaySta

title: The Best Mobile Games Of 2023
description:
It's absolutely wild to think that the gaming platform the most number of people own is the one that fits in their back pocket. And yet, it's even wilder to consider how far the games we play on these palm-sized devices have come.

Though we have it on good word that Candy Crush Saga is still going strong, each year developers prove that there's more to mobile gaming than match-3 games and solitaire (though you can bet we still have both on our phones--the classics are classics for a reason). Phones and tablets are now capable of incredible feats, with Dead by Daylight, Need For Speed, Injustice, Fortnite, Genshin Impact, Alien: Isolation, and countless other graphically intensive games proving it through their presence and popularity on App stores.

2023 brought with it a new collection of games to add to the ever-growing list of great m

title: The Best PlayStation Games Of 2023 According To Metacritic
description:
Three years into the PlayStation 5 lifecycle we're still seeing big games landing on the last-gen PS4 console, February saw the launch of PlayStation VR2, and a more svelte PS5 debuted this year. Between big-budget sequels, sharp remasters, and creatively daring original games, 2023 has been a terrific year for PlayStation gamers on the software side, with great games releasing almost weekly.

So which games were the best of the best, according to GameSpot's sister site Metacritic? Unsurprisingly, games like Marvel's Spider-Man 2, Baldur's Gate 3, and Street Fighter 6 all rose to the top of the charts once all of the numbers from various outlets had been crunched. There are some big-name exclusives near the top, while some of this year's other big winners include games that spent a long time in early access fine-tunin

title: Five Nights At Freddy's Is Now Available On 4K Blu-Ray, Steeply Discounted At Amazon
description: Five Nights at Freddy's made the jump to the big screen on October 27, grossing nearly $200 million worldwide despite earning mixed reviews from critics. Longtime fans of the series, however, found much to love about the film--which features plenty of familiar faces and carries the same unsettling, supernatural ambiance as the games. If you want to add the film to your collection, you'll be glad to know that the film just landed on 4K Blu-ray, Blu-ray, and digital. Better yet, most versions of the film are currently on sale, including the 4K format, which is just $28 (down from $45).

title: New Dune 2 Trailer Teases Massive War
description:
The newest trailer for Dune 2 has landed, and it's pretty impressive. The trailer for the sequel to the 2021 film provides a good look at what's to come, featuring the return of Timothee Chalamet, Zendaya, Rebecca Ferguson, and Josh Brolin. The sequel also stars Austin Butler, Christopher Walken, and Lea Seydoux, among others.

"Dune: Part Two will explore the mythic journey of Paul Atreides as he unites with Chani and the Fremen while on a path of revenge against the conspirators who destroyed his family," reads a line from the movie's description. "Facing a choice between the love of his life and the fate of the known universe, he endeavors to prevent a terrible future only he can foresee."

Dune 2 is directed by Denis Villeneuve, who also directed the first movie. He co-wrote the screenplay with Jon Spaihts, and the source material is Frank Herbert's iconic novel.

title: Best Buy Holiday Sale - Save Big On Games, Tech, Collectibles, And More
description:
Best Buy's holiday sale is now live, and it's offering incredible deals over the next few weeks. Laptops, desktops, headphones, video games, and hundreds of other electronics are seeing nice price cuts right now--making this the perfect time to upgrade your gear. New deals will be going live daily throughout most of December, so be sure to check back frequently. If you need help sifting through the gigantic catalog, you'll find our favorite deals below.

See all deals at Best Buy

Console Gaming

Whether you're s

title: Anne Hathaway Is Glad Her Barbie Movie Never Got Made
description:
Anne Hathaway has expressed gratitude, bordering on relief, for the Barbie movie that made it to the screens--instead of the originally planned version in which she was set to star. In a recent episode of the Happy Sad Confused podcast, she explains how the earlier version set to be directed by Alethea Jones and starring Amy Schumer faced reputed setbacks due to scheduling conflicts, eventually opening the door for Margot Robbie's production company, Lucky Chap, to step in.

"The thing that's so exciting about what Margot and Greta [Gerwig] and Ryan [Gosling] and America and that entire phenomenal team [did] is they hit a bullseye," Hathaway said (via The Hollywood Reporter). She also emphasized the impact of their version, contrasting it with the hypothetical Sony film,

title: Watchmen's Removal From Max Was An Accident
description:
Anger and frustration quickly set in when it seemed like Warner Bros. had removed another HBO series from Max--this time with Watchmen. But the DC show's disappearance was reportedly because of a technical glitch and ultimately a mistake on December 11.

According to Vulture, Watchmen isn't being scrubbed from Max after hearing from an HBO source. In fact, the accidental removal is supposedly being investigated. People were expectedly on edge after Watchmen appeared to be delisted, especially since 26 HBO Max shows and movies were pulled from the streaming service last year. Westworld was also taken away from the service

title: Best Exclusive Nintendo Games Of 2023
description: These are our very favorite Nintendo Switch games of 2023, showing just how strong the year has been for Nintendo's console-handheld hybrid. The Nintendo Switch is approaching its twilight years as persistent rumors of a successor start to seem imminent. You wouldn't know it's on its way out from the library, though, as this year is one of the strongest that the little console-handheld hybrid has ever seen.  This year, the system put its biggest names forward with both a long-anticipated sequel to The Lege

title: George Clooney Talks About That Flash Cameo
description:
DC's The Flash film finally hit theaters this summer with less-than-stellar reviews, all the while enveloped by reports of Ezra Miller's infamous behavior the past few years made the perfect recipe for a box office bomb. This doesn't even include the fact that James Gunn and Peter Safran announced their new slate of DC projects that reboots the entire DC Universe film slate of the past 10 years at the beginning of the year.

While the film revved interest from fans including Michael Keaton's long-awaited return as Bruce Wayne and Batman after 30 years, there was anoth

title: E3 Is Permanently Canceled
description:
It's official: E3 is dead. The long-running Electronic Entertainment Expo has faced numerous challenges over the last several years, and after a failed attempt to revive it once again this year, its parent company has confirmed that it is ending the gaming showcase.

pic.twitter.com/y6dtVkBvNI

— E3 (@E3) December 12, 2023

"After more than two decades of hosting an event that has served as a central showcase for the U.S. and global video game industry, the Entertainment Software Association has decided to bring E3 to a close," ESA president and CEO Stanley Pierre-Louis said to The Washington Post. "We know the entire industry, players and creators alik

title: The 20 Worst Movies Of 2023, According To Metacritic
description: 2023 has been a most fascinating year for movies. Normally we think of Disney as the big boss of Hollywood, but this was a disappointing year for the Mouse House at the box office. Instead, Universal has been dominant with three of the top five movies at the global box office--The Super Mario Bros Movie, Oppenheimer, and Fast X--with Barbie from Warner Bros taking the overall crown. Even Five Nights at Freddy's surprised, bringing in more money than any other Blumhouse film before it. But we're not here to talk about top performers. This post is, as you can guess from the headline, about bottom performers: specifically, the worst-reviewed movies of the year, according to GameSpot's sister site, Metacritic.

title: Dune And Wonka Star Timothee Chalamet Reveals His Game Of The Year
description:
Yes, he may portray Paul Atreides in Dune and the iconic chocolatier in the upcoming Wonka, but most importantly, actor Timothee Chalamet is a gamer. So in a year of critically acclaimed releases, what was his favorite for 2023?

Asked this question by IGN, Chalamet revealed that Marvel's Spider-Man 2 gets his nod. The actor said it "was just amazing," though held back at divulging his favorite part of the PS5 exclusive. "I don't want to give anything away," he said.

Calamet presented the Game of the Year award at The Game Awards last week, as Baldur's Gate 3 won at the show. The actor has also appeared in a couple of big-name titles over the past couple of years.

title: Tekken 8 - Hwoarang Arcade Quest & Versus Gameplay
description: Arcade Quest is a mode fans of Treasure Battle from prior Tekken games will recognize. Here's over 8 minutes of our favorite Tae-Kwon-Do master, Hwoarang, battling several Arcade Quest and Versus mode Ghosts and CPU's.

title: Tekken 8 - Reina, Azucena & Victor Ultra Hard CPU Gameplay
description: Here's over 8 minutes of CPU vs. CPU gameplay showcasing all of the new characters from Tekken 8 set to Ultra Hard difficulty, including Reina, Azucena, and Victor. We've also included a bonus Player vs Ultra Hard CPU match between Hwoarang and Claudio. Let us know if you're hyped for Tekken 8 in the comments below!

title: Saw 11 Announced, As Lionsgate Declares, "The Game Continues"
description:
The Saw franchise will continue with an 11th mainline installment, Lionsgate has announced. Saw XI has been confirmed and will debut on September 27, 2024, the film studio announced on social media. "The game continues," Lionsgate said.

The confirmation of the next Saw movie comes not long after Saw X debuted at the end of September and was a fast success. It brought in more than $107 million against a modest budget of $13 million, so it's no surprise to see another sequel get greenlit.

Saw X director Kevin Greutert told The Hollywood Reporter that Saw X was meant to be a "final send-off" for the Jigsaw character. However, Greutert said he had a "never say never" attitude about bringing him back.
